definition: Aesop (trad. 620-560 BC), Greek slave and storyteller, supposed author of Aesop's fables
surname Yi/abbr. for 伊拉克[Yi1 la1 ke4], Iraq/abbr. for 伊朗[Yi1 lang3], Iran

(old) third person singular pronoun ("he" or "she")/second person singular pronoun ("you")/(May 4th period) third person singular feminine pronoun ("she")/(Classical Chinese) introductory particle with no specific meaning/that (preceding a noun)
to search/to demand/to ask/to exact/large rope/isolated
surname Suo/abbr. for 索馬里|索马里[Suo3 ma3 li3], Somalia

sentences.english: "Aesop's Fables" is one of my favorite extra-curricular reading books.
sentences.chinese: 《伊索寓言》这本书是我最喜爱读的课外书之一。

sentences.english: Aesop's Fables is a collection of fables.
sentences.chinese: 《伊索寓言》是一部寓言故事集。
《伊索寓言》中有一些是讽刺作品。

sentences.english: Reaffiliate Aesop"s allegory about the turtle and the aerial that had a chase?"
sentences.chinese: 记得再龟兔赛跑这则伊索寓言吗？

sentences.english: Aesop is one of the most famous storytellers of all time.
sentences.chinese: 伊索是历史上相当著名的说故事家。

sentences.english: The first story was Aesop’s fable The Tortoise and the Hare.
sentences.chinese: 第一个故事是来自伊索寓言中乌龟和野兔赛跑的故事。

sentences.english: The first one I bathed was a girl, who we named Isolde.
sentences.chinese: 我沐浴着第一个是一个女孩，我们命名伊索尔德。

sentences.english: Greek myths, as well as the fables of Aesop , inherited them from the Vedas and Buddhism;
sentences.chinese: 希腊神话和伊索寓言是从吠陀经和佛教传袭下来的。

sentences.english: Aesop was the master of the apologue.
Isolder grew up in a world of luxury.
sentences.chinese: 伊索尔德生长在一个奢华的世界里。

sentences.english: People say that a man called Aesop told such stories more than two thousand years ago.
sentences.chinese: 听说二千多年前有一位叫伊索的人讲了这样子的故事。

sentences.english: There's no better example of this than Aesop's fables.
sentences.chinese: 关于这一点没有比伊索寓言更佳的例子了。

sentences.english: Now, Aesop clearly verges on ‘determinism’ here.
sentences.chinese: 显然，伊索在这则寓言里讲的是“本性论”。

sentences.english: Tristan clocks in at four hours.
sentences.chinese: 《特里斯坦和伊索尔德》要演四个小时。

sentences.english: Remember Aesop's fable about the turtle and the rabbit that had a race?
sentences.chinese: 记得再龟兔赛跑这则伊索寓言吗？

definition: Socrates (469-399 BC), Greek philosopher/José Sócrates (1957-), prime minister of Portugal (2005-2011)

Amun, deity in Egyptian mythology, also spelled Amon, Amoun, Amen, and rarely Imen
name of weed plant (fat hen, goosefoot, pigweed etc)/Chenopodium album
Sophocles (496-406 BC), Greek tragedian, author of Oedipus the King
